original_text: We order the discrete unknowns so that the vector of unknowns, xPS=[X,L], contains the nx unknown nodal coordinates, followed by the nb unknown discrete Lagrange multipliers. The linear systems to be solved in the course of the Newton-based solution of Eq. (10), subject to the displacement constraint (9), then have saddle-point structure,(15)where E is the tangent stiffness matrix of the unconstrained pseudo-solid problem, and the two off-diagonal blocks Cxl and Clx=CxlT arise through the imposition of the displacement constraint by the Lagrange multipliers. We refer to [34] for the proof of the LBB stability of this discretisation; see also [35,36] for a discussion of the LBB stability of the Lagrange-multiplier-based imposition of Dirichlet boundary conditions in related problems. We note that during the first step of the Newton iteration, E is symmetric positive definite since it represents the tangent stiffness matrix relative to the systems equilibrium configuration.
original_translation: Ordenamos las incógnitas discretas de manera que el vector de incógnitas, xPS=[X,L], contenga las nx coordenadas nodales desconocidas, seguidas de los nb multiplicadores de Lagrange discretos desconocidos. Los sistemas lineales a resolver en el transcurso de la solución basada en Newton de la Ec. (10), sujeta a la restricción de desplazamiento (9), tienen entonces una estructura de punto de silla, (15) donde E es la matriz de rigidez tangente del problema pseudo-sólido no restringido, y los dos bloques fuera de la diagonal Cxl y Clx=CxlT surgen a través de la imposición de la restricción de desplazamiento por los multiplicadores de Lagrange. Nos referimos a [34] para la demostración de la estabilidad LBB de esta discretización; ver también [35,36] para una discusión de la estabilidad LBB de la imposición de condiciones de contorno de Dirichlet basadas en multiplicadores de Lagrange en problemas relacionados. Destacamos que durante el primer paso de la iteración de Newton, E es simétrica y definida positiva ya que representa la matriz de rigidez tangente relativa a la configuración de equilibrio de los sistemas.

We refer to [34] for the proof of the LBB stability of this discretisation; see also [35,36] for a discussion of the LBB stability of the Lagrange-multiplier-based imposition of Dirichlet boundary conditions in related problems.
We note that during the first step of the Newton iteration, E is symmetric positive definite since it represents the tangent stiffness matrix relative to the systems equilibrium configuration.

de esta discretización; ver también [35,36] para una discusión de la
estabilidad LBB
de la imposición de condiciones de contorno de Dirichlet basadas en multiplicadores de Lagrange en problemas relacionados. Destacamos que durante el primer paso de la iteración de Newton, E es simétrica y definida positiva ya que representa la matriz de rigidez tangente relativa a la configuración de equilibrio de los sistemas.

original_annotated_sentences: We order the discrete unknowns so that the vector of unknowns, xPS=[X,L], contains the nx unknown nodal coordinates, followed by the nb unknown discrete Lagrange multipliers.

The linear systems to be solved in the course of the
Newton-based solution
of Eq. (10), subject to the displacement constraint (9), then have saddle-point structure,(15)where E is the tangent stiffness matrix of the unconstrained pseudo-solid problem, and the two off-diagonal blocks Cxl and Clx=CxlT arise through the imposition of the displacement constraint by the Lagrange multipliers.

We refer to [34] for the proof of the LBB stability of this discretisation; see also [35,36] for a discussion of the LBB stability of the Lagrange-multiplier-based imposition of Dirichlet boundary conditions in related problems.
We note that during the first step of the Newton iteration, E is symmetric positive definite since it represents the tangent stiffness matrix relative to the systems equilibrium configuration.
